value: chapter 7 the church world gone mad the
dream haunted me I woke in the pre-dawn
darkness my breath quick and shallow the
vision still burning in my mind my wife
lay asleep next to me undisturbed I
settled back into bed swallowing
wondering what was going on I had seen
my pastor from the Wesleyan holiness
church we had been attending for the
past several months he stood in the
pulpit looking out over the congregation
to shadowy figures stood on his right
and his left they had actually taken on
the lightness of my pastor just as he
had an egg-shaped bald head these two
shadowy figures had more grotesque
bulbous shaped craniums for weeks i had
no idea what the dream meant my pastor
seemed like a warm funny delightful man
who password the small community church
perhaps I'd eaten some bad pizza or my
highly active imagination had simply
gone into overdrive one evening in our
small studio apartment as I was working
on some studies and my wife was
strumming her guitar I looked up at her
and said honey I have to go out and
preach I have to I'd first done open air
preaching over a year ago down in Texas
but with my new marriage going to school
full time and the move from Texas to
Oregon I had let my passion for
evangelism slumber for weeks as I walked
back and forth between my college in our
apartment I felt Yas spirit pricking me
urging me to get back on the streets to
win the lost that friday evening my wife
and i ventured into downtown eugene like
many towns in the Pacific Northwest this
one had an outdoor market square lined
with shops by day it was a fun place for
families a couple eating out shopping or
enjoying the glittering streams of a
nearby town
but by night it was a completely
different story drug addicts gang
members Runaways and street kids crowded
the area that first friday night i
remember waiting through the crowds I my
surroundings nervously seemed like the
worst place of magic to any preacher
visions of getting mugged to flash
through my mind I shuddered maybe I had
misheard from the Lord maybe this had
all been one huge mistake I grabbed my
wife's hand to begin to lead her back
where our car my wife stopped Daniel
aren't you going to preach the words
made me wince I'd very clearly laid out
my strong conviction to evangelize here
I was limping out exactly remember the
entire conversation we had but I at last
said yes I need to preach I need to just
do this I jumped onto the stone ledge of
a fountain and began lifting up my voice
preaching on 1st Corinthians 6 9 through
11 the ground turned to me frozen unsure
what to make of me I don't think they
had ever even seen an open-air preacher
before I only priest for a short time
that night before rain gusts from the
sky my wife tightened her hood over her
head and ran for shelter I continued to
preach the rain had much in the crowd
though also seeking shelter from the
nearby buildings continued to listen a
rush of excitement filled me the creator
of the heavens and earth was actually
using me to reach others and even the
rain was not driving them away in
retrospect I see that first night of
preaching was Yas gift to me he
graciously used the elements to protect
me from any hecklers giving me the
courage I needed to start evangelizing
after a year of silence my wife and I
returned home that night celebrating
joyfully recounting what had happened
for weeks every Friday night we continue
to preach in downtown eugene however it
steadily began to become more dangerous
one night as I still in the fountain a
drunken man staggered toward me and
poured alcohol all over my clothes he
taunted me with his lighter saying he
would try to light me on fire another
night one young man stuck strung out on
drugs pulled out a knife at lunch
fortunately another street preacher who
had joined me that night grabbed the
man's arm and was able to calm him down
until his friends took him away still on
yet another evening one guy punched me
right in the face I remember twirling
around hitting the wall behind me and
slumping to the floor before rising to
my feet once again but through all the
violence Yahweh continued to sustain us
one evening as the Golden Sun still
painted downtown eugene in a rich golden
to you i was once again preaching on 1st
Corinthians 6 9 through 11 no whore or
whoremonger shall inherit the kingdom of
god evidently a young lutely dressed
woman thought that i had called her a
whore even though i had not it was
merely preaching a text she angrily
called the police a heavyset officer
arrived on the scene when I explained to
the police officer that I've merely been
preaching from the Bible and had not
called the woman any names he refused to
believe me leaving close to me his nose
almost touching mine he warned and come
down here preaching again I'm going to
arrest you shaken not sure what to do my
wife and I went home that night I knew I
had not violated any laws the First
Amendment covered my freedom of speech
more importantly I also knew the Holy
Spirit had directed me to preach at that
location I called my pastor and told him
about what had happened don't worry
Daniel I think I'd like to come down
with you this next Friday night and help
you breach I rejoiced surely this was
the sign I needed to keep on persevering
Friday night arrived my pastor stood
next to me as I began preaching a crowd
sued gathered around us as I looked in
my Bible in one hand declaring the word
I felt strong hands grabbing my arms
cold handcuffs locked around my wrists
and the officer shoved me into his cop
car as I sat in the backseat the officer
looked at me angrily I told you not to
come back and preach I have to do what
God tells me to do I said simply in the
downtown police station they booked me
and threw me in with about five or six
of the men
I immediately began evangelizing have
the same angry police officer burst into
the holding tank oh no you don't he
shoved me into an isolated cell
remembering what Paul of the early
apostles did in a similar situation I
began to worship the cement walls of the
tiny cell provided perfect acoustics my
voice echoed all around me and I
couldn't help but wonder if angels were
joining with me as I sang to the most
high after only a few hours they
released me and my pastor picked me up
from jail a few days later my pastor
called Daniel could you come over to my
house I want to talk to you about some
things something in his voice didn't
sound quite right and I remembered the
dream I wondered if now I would finally
understand what yah had been trying to
show me holding a hot dog in his hand he
greeted me at the door and invited me in
let me just finish my lunch he said is
he wolf down the rest of his food I took
a seat as living room and waited my
pastor smiled at me nervously before
taking a seat across from me listen
Daniel I thought your preaching was
great but look if it's going to get you
arrested maybe we should just tone
things down I was shocked I thought for
sure if one man would support me it
would be my pastor I could only sit and
stop silence sometimes I think we just
need to figure out a different way to
evangelize one maybe that's less
controversial pastor I have to do what
God is calling you to do when the
Apostles went out preached even though
they were off and arrested thus this
didn't stop them from doing what God had
called him to do he smiled and nodded
but it was as if you were looking right
I left his home that afternoon feeling
disgusted and disheartened my wife and I
would continue to go out and preach in
downtown eugene and i was never bothered
by the local police again in fact about
three years later a jewish attorney who
had agreed to represent me in court for
a mere 25 bucks a month help me to win
my case against the city of Eugene for
unlawfully arrest
but at only 19 years of age I
encountered for the very first time the
dark religious spirits that can control
church leadership in the scriptures we
read of Messiah Yahshua warning us that
there will be wolves among the Sheep we
also eat a Matthew 24 that at the end
times a period of betrayal will cause
believers to turn on each other I think
in a small way this first lesson taught
me that not everything is as it appears
in the church world
